alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the northwestern City of Chesapeake and the central City of Suffolk through 645 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Holland, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Downtown Suffolk and Kings Fork around 630 PM EDT. Driver around 640 PM EDT. Chesapeake and Bowers Hill around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Wilroy, Lummis, Nurney, Kilby, Suffolk Airport, Deanes, Saunders and Magnolia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
